    Japanese Studies

    Our global partner universities for Japanese Studies.

    Off

    Undergraduate study abroad options

    You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change.

    Japan

    Akita International University

    Akita International University, Japan

    Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services.

    Study at Akita International University

    Aoyama Gaukin University

    Aoyama Gakuin University, Japan

    Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity.

    Study at Aoyama Gakuin University

    Chuo University

    Chuo University, Japan

    Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country.

    Study at Chuo University

    Doshisha University

    Doshisha University, Japan

    Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story.

    Study at Doshisha University

    Hiroshima University

    Hiroshima University, Japan

    Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students.

    Study at Hiroshima University

    Hokkaido University

    Hokkaido University, Japan

    Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan.

    Study at Hokkaido University

    Hosei University

    Hosei University, Japan

    Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community.

    Study at Hosei University

    International Christian University

    International Christian University, Japan

    International Christian University holds as its mission the establishment of an academic tradition of freedom and reverence based on Christian ideals as well as the cultivation of internationally minded citizens who perform service to God and humankind and make contributions to lasting peace.

    Study at International Christian University

    Kanazawa University

    Kanazawa University, Japan

    As the leading university on the Sea of Japan coast, Kanazawa University has contributed greatly to Japanese higher education and academic research since it was founded in 1949.

    Study at Kanazawa University

    Keio University

    Keio University, Japan

    Established in 1858 by Yukichi Fukuzawa as a small school of Western learning, Keio has a history as Japan’s very first private institution of higher learning.

    Study at Keio University

    Kobe University

    Kobe University, Japan

    Kobe University, working in a spirit of integrity, freedom, and cooperation in keeping with its open and cosmopolitan culture and environs, aims to contribute to the global community through the creation of knowledge founded on universal values and the fostering of rich understanding and strong leadership skills.

    Study at Kobe University

    Kyoto University

    Kyoto University, Japan

    Kyoto University states its mission to sustain and develop its historical commitment to academic freedom and to pursue harmonious coexistence within the human and ecological community on this planet.

    Study at Kyoto University

    Kyushu University

    Kyushu University, Japan

    Kyushu University, abbreviated to Kyudai, is a Japanese national university located in Fukuoka, in the island of Kyushu. It is the 4th oldest university in Japan and one of the former Imperial Universities.

    Study at Kyushu University

    Meiji University

    Meiji University, Japan

    Meiji University was founded in January 1881 as the Meiji Law School by a group of young lawyers barely in their 30's: Tatsuo Kishimoto, Kozo Miyagi, and Misao Yashiro. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation.

    Study at Meiji University

    Nagoya University

    Nagoya University, Japan

    We aim to cultivate talented people who can exercise strong leadership in a rapidly changing world with their great wisdom and reliable knowledge and skills.

    Study at Nagoya University

    Okayama University

    Okayama University, Japan

    As one of the leading universities in Japan, we aim to create and establish a new paradigm for the sustainable development of the world. We are being confronted with problems of global proportions in terms of the environment, energy issues, food supplies, economics, health, security and education.

    Study at Okayama University

    Otaru University of Commerce

    Otaru University of Commerce, Japan

    Otaru University of Commerce is and has been a center of social sciences and humanities in northern Japan. Reflecting its history of having been established as Otaru Higher Commercial School, the university has been emphasizing the link between theory and practice, in addition to its solid academic foundation.

    Study at Otaru University of Commerce

    Rikkyo University

    Rikkyo University, Japan

    Rikkyo University started in 1874 as Rikkyo School, a small private school teaching English and Bible studies in the foreign settlement in Tsukiji, Tokyo. The School was founded by Bishop Channing Moore Williams, a missionary dispatched from the American Episcopal Church.

    Study at Rikkyo University

    Ritsumeikan University

    Ritsumeikan University, Japan

    Ritsumeikan University traces its origins back to 1869. It is now a university of around 35,000 students, situated in the city of Kyoto.

    Study at Ritsumeikan University

    Seijo University

    Seijo University, Japan

    Seijo University is well-known for its focus on the arts and social sciences, as well as its liberal atmosphere. Relatively small in size, our institution has adhered to its founding educational principles to foster broad-minded, well-rounded graduates, who are highly creative and are well prepared to do their part for society.

    Study at Seijo University

    Sophia University

    Sophia University, Japan

    The origin of Sophia University can be traced back to more than 450 years ago when the Jesuit missionary Francis Xavier came to Japan in 1549 to spread Christianity in Japan. Since then it has developed into one of Japan's leading research universities, and is based in the heart of Tokyo.

    Study at Sophia University

    Tohoku University

    Tohoku University, Japan

    The university has around 20,000 students and is based in the city of Sendai in Miyagi. The ancient castle grounds of Sendai's famous feudal war lord Masamune Date, are home to the majority of Tohoku University's facilities.

    Study at Tohoku University

    Tsukuba University

    Tsukuba University, Japan

    The University of Tsukuba aims to be an open university in all aspects and we are a frontrunner in the university reform in Japan. Our fundamental principle is to create a flexible education and research structure as well as a university system to meet the needs of the next generation.

    Study at Tsukuba University

    University of Osaka

    The University of Osaka University, Japan

    The University of Osaka, or Handai, is a public research university located in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Osaka University is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is generally considered one of Japan's most prestigious institutions of higher learning.

    Study at the University of Osaka

    University of the Ryukyus

    University of the Ryukyus, Japan

    The University of the Ryukyus, abbreviated to Ryūdai, is a national university of Japan in Okinawa Prefecture. It is located in the Senbaru neighbourhood of the town of Nishihara, with its campus bordering both the village of Nakagusuku and the city of Ginowan.

    Study at University of the Ryukyus

    University of Tokyo

    University of Tokyo, Japan

    The University of Tokyo is comprised of 10 Faculties, 15 Graduate Schools, 11 affiliated research institutes (including the Research Center for Advanced Science and Technology), 13 University-wide centers, three affiliated libraries and two institutes for advanced study.

    Study at University of Tokyo

    Waseda University

    Waseda University, Japan

    Waseda’s culture and traditions have evolved over time since 1882, but its founding principles remain firm. The Waseda spirit lives in the hearts of over 600,000 alumni. Here we present the changing and unchanged about the university.

    Study at Waseda University

    Yokohama National University

    Yokohama National University, Japan

    Ever since the port of Yokohama was opened in the 19th century, Yokohama has been a unique crossroad where West meets East. It is not too much to say that the modernization and internationalization of Japan started from Yokohama. Today, as Japan’s second largest city, Yokohama is recognized as one of the most exciting cities for its cultural, socio-economic, and infrastructural dynamism.

    Study at Yokohama National University

    A global reputation

    Sheffield is a world top-100 research university with a global reputation for excellence. We're a member of the Russell Group: one of the 24 leading UK universities for research and teaching.

    About the University

    The University of Sheffield

# Japanese Studies
Our global partner universities for Japanese Studies.
Off 
## Undergraduate study abroad options
You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change.
### Japan 

[Akita International University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#AkitaInternationalUniversity)
    
![Akita International University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Exterior_of_Akita_International_University_Nakajima_Memorial_Library.jpg?h=9f320072&itok=K0eiBESr)
Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services. 

[Aoyama Gaukin University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#AoyamaGaukinUniversity)
    
![Aoyama Gakuin University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Aoyama_Gakuin_University_Sagamihara.jpg?h=1051cd3d&itok=7w5FKBZw)
Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity. 

[Chuo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#ChuoUniversity)
    
![Chuo University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/C-Square%2C_Tama_Campus%2C_Chuo_University.jpg?h=cd88aec0&itok=Ryq81dgE)
Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country. 

[Doshisha University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#DoshishaUniversity)
    
![Doshisha University from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/170128_Doshisha_University_Imadegawa_Campus_Kyoto_Japan08s3.jpg?h=666c4245&itok=MyXAzMIF)
Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story. 

[Hiroshima University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HiroshimaUniversity)
    
![Hiroshima University from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Hiroshima_University_Hospital_20140127.jpg?h=04850f14&itok=yGBsnmy1)
Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students. 

[Hokkaido University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HokkaidoUniversity)
    
![Hokkaido University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/The_Hokkaido_University_Museum.jpg?h=825ad812&itok=HaWSQ5xR)
Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan. 

[Hosei University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HoseiUniversity)
    
![Hosei University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Ichigayatamachi_Building_-_Hosei_University_-_Shinjuku%2C_Tokyo%2C_Japan_-_DSC04580.jpg?h=ed5d71d4&itok=yfj1I8vM)
Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community. 

[International Christian University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#InternationalChristianUniversity)
    
![Fall foliage at Ghibli Museum in Mitaka, Japan.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/GettyImages-488332371.jpg?h=0296cbd6&itok=O4dUd6SB)
International Christian University holds as its mission the establishment of an academic tradition of freedom and reverence based on Christian ideals as well as the cultivation of internationally minded citizens who perform service to God and humankind and make contributions to lasting peace. 

[Kanazawa University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KanazawaUniversity)
    
![Administrative office for kanazawa university](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Administrative_Office_of_Kanazawa_University.jpg?h=b2ac61e6&itok=nNgYeFq0)
As the leading university on the Sea of Japan coast, Kanazawa University has contributed greatly to Japanese higher education and academic research since it was founded in 1949. 

[Keio University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KeioUniversity)
    
![Keio University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Old_Keio_University_Library_4.jpg?h=7bc0b7d3&itok=ehPHjKOe)
Established in 1858 by Yukichi Fukuzawa as a small school of Western learning, Keio has a history as Japan’s very first private institution of higher learning. 

[Kobe University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KobeUniversity)
    
![Kobe University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/6005484934_23f8e708e6_b.jpg?h=6c3a7702&itok=0LaLZ3sU)
Kobe University, working in a spirit of integrity, freedom, and cooperation in keeping with its open and cosmopolitan culture and environs, aims to contribute to the global community through the creation of knowledge founded on universal values and the fostering of rich understanding and strong leadership skills. 

[Kyoto University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KyotoUniversity)
    
![Kyoto University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Kyoto_University_-_2009%27_faculty_members_strikes.jpg?h=f8018def&itok=EbibgWFb)
Kyoto University states its mission to sustain and develop its historical commitment to academic freedom and to pursue harmonious coexistence within the human and ecological community on this planet. 

[Kyushu University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KyushuUniversity)
    
![Kyushu University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Kyushu_University_Ito_Campus_Center_Zone_and_main_entrance_20180807.jpg?h=dd7be773&itok=ly4zmaX0)
Kyushu University, abbreviated to Kyudai, is a Japanese national university located in Fukuoka, in the island of Kyushu. It is the 4th oldest university in Japan and one of the former Imperial Universities. 

[Meiji University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#MeijiUniversity)
    
![Meiji University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Meiji_University_Nakano%2CCampus_%26_TeikyoHeiseiUniv-Nakano_2014.jpg?h=7cc22ff2&itok=Yj-v8YY-)
Meiji University was founded in January 1881 as the Meiji Law School by a group of young lawyers barely in their 30's: Tatsuo Kishimoto, Kozo Miyagi, and Misao Yashiro. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation. 

[Nagoya University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#NagoyaUniversity)
    
![Nagoya University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Nagoya_University_dk4586.jpg?h=44faebae&itok=TXJAowPB)
We aim to cultivate talented people who can exercise strong leadership in a rapidly changing world with their great wisdom and reliable knowledge and skills. 

[Okayama University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#OkayamaUniversity)
    
![Okayama University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Okayama_University_tsushima03.jpg?h=380cbecd&itok=SKutKFD3)
As one of the leading universities in Japan, we aim to create and establish a new paradigm for the sustainable development of the world. We are being confronted with problems of global proportions in terms of the environment, energy issues, food supplies, economics, health, security and education. 

[Otaru University of Commerce](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#OtaruUniversityofCommerce)
    
![Otaru canal](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Otaru_Hokkaido_Japan.jpg?h=47c8826e&itok=smmglzYs)
Otaru University of Commerce is and has been a center of social sciences and humanities in northern Japan. Reflecting its history of having been established as Otaru Higher Commercial School, the university has been emphasizing the link between theory and practice, in addition to its solid academic foundation. 

[Rikkyo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#RikkyoUniversity)
    
![Rikkyo University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/2018_Rikkyo_University_2_0.jpg?h=4ca3ccec&itok=OBxRXuEC)
Rikkyo University started in 1874 as Rikkyo School, a small private school teaching English and Bible studies in the foreign settlement in Tsukiji, Tokyo. The School was founded by Bishop Channing Moore Williams, a missionary dispatched from the American Episcopal Church. 

[Ritsumeikan University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#RitsumeikanUniversity)
    
![Ritsumeikan University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Zonshinkan_Hall_at_Ritsumeikan_Univ.jpg?h=f7b0690c&itok=F-udErAG)
Ritsumeikan University traces its origins back to 1869. It is now a university of around 35,000 students, situated in the city of Kyoto. 

[Seijo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#SeijoUniversity)
    
![Seijo University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Seijouniv2012055.jpg?h=83f468d0&itok=lPX2Pk8S)
Seijo University is well-known for its focus on the arts and social sciences, as well as its liberal atmosphere. Relatively small in size, our institution has adhered to its founding educational principles to foster broad-minded, well-rounded graduates, who are highly creative and are well prepared to do their part for society. 

[Sophia University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#SophiaUniversity)
    
![Sophia University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/12494889943_d0020a10a8_o.jpg?h=75e319e6&itok=0FqwfE0z)
The origin of Sophia University can be traced back to more than 450 years ago when the Jesuit missionary Francis Xavier came to Japan in 1549 to spread Christianity in Japan. Since then it has developed into one of Japan's leading research universities, and is based in the heart of Tokyo. 

[Tohoku University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#TohokuUniversity)
    
![Tohoku University buildings](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Tohoku_University_Hospital.jpg?h=93655462&itok=s_LcwWzh)
The university has around 20,000 students and is based in the city of Sendai in Miyagi. The ancient castle grounds of Sendai's famous feudal war lord Masamune Date, are home to the majority of Tohoku University's facilities. 

[Tsukuba University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#TsukubaUniversity)
    
![Tsukuba University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/University_of_Tsukuba_1.jpg?h=fae4e345&itok=I_pwPfrV)
The University of Tsukuba aims to be an open university in all aspects and we are a frontrunner in the university reform in Japan. Our fundamental principle is to create a flexible education and research structure as well as a university system to meet the needs of the next generation. 

[University of Osaka](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityofOsaka)
    
![Osaka University main entrance.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Osaka_university_toyonaka_main_entrance.jpg?h=7c9da7f9&itok=Gj8m0jpA)
The University of Osaka, or Handai, is a public research university located in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Osaka University is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is generally considered one of Japan's most prestigious institutions of higher learning. 

[University of the Ryukyus](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityoftheRyukyus)
    
![University of the Ryukyus hospital from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Ryukyu-univ_hospital.jpg?h=8d4f0e53&itok=yu95-mHi)
The University of the Ryukyus, abbreviated to Ryūdai, is a national university of Japan in Okinawa Prefecture. It is located in the Senbaru neighbourhood of the town of Nishihara, with its campus bordering both the village of Nakagusuku and the city of Ginowan. 

[University of Tokyo](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityofTokyo)
    
![University of Tokyo tower](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Yasuda_Auditorium%2C_Tokyo_University_-_Nov_2005.jpg?h=88c97200&itok=sL2Eobfz)
The University of Tokyo is comprised of 10 Faculties, 15 Graduate Schools, 11 affiliated research institutes (including the Research Center for Advanced Science and Technology), 13 University-wide centers, three affiliated libraries and two institutes for advanced study. 

[Waseda University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#WasedaUniversity)
    
![Aerial photo of Waseda University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Waseda_university_-_Waseda_campus.jpg?h=b5941091&itok=mab9adsJ)
Waseda’s culture and traditions have evolved over time since 1882, but its founding principles remain firm. The Waseda spirit lives in the hearts of over 600,000 alumni. Here we present the changing and unchanged about the university. 

[Yokohama National University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#YokohamaNationalUniversity)
    
![Yokohama National University library](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/YNU_library.jpg?h=16ef794e&itok=QwNEnqbz)
Ever since the port of Yokohama was opened in the 19th century, Yokohama has been a unique crossroad where West meets East. It is not too much to say that the modernization and internationalization of Japan started from Yokohama. Today, as Japan’s second largest city, Yokohama is recognized as one of the most exciting cities for its cultural, socio-economic, and infrastructural dynamism.
## A global reputation
Sheffield is a world top-100 research university with a global reputation for excellence. We're a member of the Russell Group: one of the 24 leading UK universities for research and teaching.

images.alt: Akita International University from the outside
images.desc: Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services.

Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity.

Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country.

Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story.

Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students.

Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan.
Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community.

    Japanese Studies

    Our global partner universities for Japanese Studies.

    Undergraduate study abroad options

    You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change.

    Akita International University, Japan

    Meiji University was founded in January 1881 as the Meiji Law School by a group of young lawyers barely in their 30's: Tatsuo Kishimoto, Kozo Miyagi, and Misao Yashiro. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation.

Japanese Studies

Our global partner universities for Japanese Studies.

Off

Undergraduate study abroad options

You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change.

Japan

Akita International University

Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services.

Aoyama Gaukin University

Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity.

Chuo University

Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country.

Doshisha University

Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story.

Hiroshima University

Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students.

Hokkaido University

Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan.

Hosei University

Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community.

International Christian University

International Christian University holds as its mission the establishment of an academic tradition of freedom and reverence based on Christian ideals as well as the cultivation of internationally minded citizens who perform service to God and humankind and make contributions to lasting peace.

Kanazawa University

As the leading university on the Sea of Japan coast, Kanazawa University has contributed greatly to Japanese higher education and academic research since it was founded in 1949.

Keio University

Established in 1858 by Yukichi Fukuzawa as a small school of Western learning, Keio has a history as Japan’s very first private institution of higher learning.

Kobe University

Kobe University, working in a spirit of integrity, freedom, and cooperation in keeping with its open and cosmopolitan culture and environs, aims to contribute to the global community through the creation of knowledge founded on universal values and the fostering of rich understanding and strong leadership skills.

Kyoto University

Kyoto University states its mission to sustain and develop its historical commitment to academic freedom and to pursue harmonious coexistence within the human and ecological community on this planet.

Kyushu University

Kyushu University, abbreviated to Kyudai, is a Japanese national university located in Fukuoka, in the island of Kyushu. It is the 4th oldest university in Japan and one of the former Imperial Universities.

Meiji University

Meiji University was founded in January 1881 as the Meiji Law School by a group of young lawyers barely in their 30's: Tatsuo Kishimoto, Kozo Miyagi, and Misao Yashiro. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation.

Nagoya University

We aim to cultivate talented people who can exercise strong leadership in a rapidly changing world with their great wisdom and reliable knowledge and skills.

Okayama University

As one of the leading universities in Japan, we aim to create and establish a new paradigm for the sustainable development of the world. We are being confronted with problems of global proportions in terms of the environment, energy issues, food supplies, economics, health, security and education.

Otaru University of Commerce

Otaru University of Commerce is and has been a center of social sciences and humanities in northern Japan. Reflecting its history of having been established as Otaru Higher Commercial School, the university has been emphasizing the link between theory and practice, in addition to its solid academic foundation.

Rikkyo University

Rikkyo University started in 1874 as Rikkyo School, a small private school teaching English and Bible studies in the foreign settlement in Tsukiji, Tokyo. The School was founded by Bishop Channing Moore Williams, a missionary dispatched from the American Episcopal Church.

Ritsumeikan University

Ritsumeikan University traces its origins back to 1869. It is now a university of around 35,000 students, situated in the city of Kyoto.

Seijo University

Seijo University is well-known for its focus on the arts and social sciences, as well as its liberal atmosphere. Relatively small in size, our institution has adhered to its founding educational principles to foster broad-minded, well-rounded graduates, who are highly creative and are well prepared to do their part for society.

Sophia University

The origin of Sophia University can be traced back to more than 450 years ago when the Jesuit missionary Francis Xavier came to Japan in 1549 to spread Christianity in Japan. Since then it has developed into one of Japan's leading research universities, and is based in the heart of Tokyo.

Tohoku University

The university has around 20,000 students and is based in the city of Sendai in Miyagi. The ancient castle grounds of Sendai's famous feudal war lord Masamune Date, are home to the majority of Tohoku University's facilities.

Tsukuba University

The University of Tsukuba aims to be an open university in all aspects and we are a frontrunner in the university reform in Japan. Our fundamental principle is to create a flexible education and research structure as well as a university system to meet the needs of the next generation.

University of Osaka

The University of Osaka, or Handai, is a public research university located in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Osaka University is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is generally considered one of Japan's most prestigious institutions of higher learning.

University of the Ryukyus

The University of the Ryukyus, abbreviated to Ryūdai, is a national university of Japan in Okinawa Prefecture. It is located in the Senbaru neighbourhood of the town of Nishihara, with its campus bordering both the village of Nakagusuku and the city of Ginowan.

University of Tokyo

The University of Tokyo is comprised of 10 Faculties, 15 Graduate Schools, 11 affiliated research institutes (including the Research Center for Advanced Science and Technology), 13 University-wide centers, three affiliated libraries and two institutes for advanced study.

Waseda University

Waseda’s culture and traditions have evolved over time since 1882, but its founding principles remain firm. The Waseda spirit lives in the hearts of over 600,000 alumni. Here we present the changing and unchanged about the university.

Yokohama National University

Ever since the port of Yokohama was opened in the 19th century, Yokohama has been a unique crossroad where West meets East. It is not too much to say that the modernization and internationalization of Japan started from Yokohama. Today, as Japan’s second largest city, Yokohama is recognized as one of the most exciting cities for its cultural, socio-economic, and infrastructural dynamism.

A global reputation

Sheffield is a world top-100 research university with a global reputation for excellence. We're a member of the Russell Group: one of the 24 leading UK universities for research and teaching.

# Japanese Studies
Our global partner universities for Japanese Studies.
Off 
## Undergraduate study abroad options
You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change.
### Japan 

[Akita International University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#AkitaInternationalUniversity)
    
![Akita International University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Exterior_of_Akita_International_University_Nakajima_Memorial_Library.jpg?h=9f320072&itok=K0eiBESr)
Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services. 

[Aoyama Gaukin University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#AoyamaGaukinUniversity)
    
![Aoyama Gakuin University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Aoyama_Gakuin_University_Sagamihara.jpg?h=1051cd3d&itok=7w5FKBZw)
Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity. 

[Chuo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#ChuoUniversity)
    
![Chuo University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/C-Square%2C_Tama_Campus%2C_Chuo_University.jpg?h=cd88aec0&itok=Ryq81dgE)
Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country. 

[Doshisha University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#DoshishaUniversity)
    
![Doshisha University from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/170128_Doshisha_University_Imadegawa_Campus_Kyoto_Japan08s3.jpg?h=666c4245&itok=MyXAzMIF)
Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story. 

[Hiroshima University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HiroshimaUniversity)
    
![Hiroshima University from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Hiroshima_University_Hospital_20140127.jpg?h=04850f14&itok=yGBsnmy1)
Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students. 

[Hokkaido University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HokkaidoUniversity)
    
![Hokkaido University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/The_Hokkaido_University_Museum.jpg?h=825ad812&itok=HaWSQ5xR)
Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan. 

[Hosei University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HoseiUniversity)
    
![Hosei University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Ichigayatamachi_Building_-_Hosei_University_-_Shinjuku%2C_Tokyo%2C_Japan_-_DSC04580.jpg?h=ed5d71d4&itok=yfj1I8vM)
Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community. 

[International Christian University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#InternationalChristianUniversity)
    
![Fall foliage at Ghibli Museum in Mitaka, Japan.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/GettyImages-488332371.jpg?h=0296cbd6&itok=O4dUd6SB)
International Christian University holds as its mission the establishment of an academic tradition of freedom and reverence based on Christian ideals as well as the cultivation of internationally minded citizens who perform service to God and humankind and make contributions to lasting peace. 

[Kanazawa University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KanazawaUniversity)
    
![Administrative office for kanazawa university](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Administrative_Office_of_Kanazawa_University.jpg?h=b2ac61e6&itok=nNgYeFq0)
As the leading university on the Sea of Japan coast, Kanazawa University has contributed greatly to Japanese higher education and academic research since it was founded in 1949. 

[Keio University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KeioUniversity)
    
![Keio University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Old_Keio_University_Library_4.jpg?h=7bc0b7d3&itok=ehPHjKOe)
Established in 1858 by Yukichi Fukuzawa as a small school of Western learning, Keio has a history as Japan’s very first private institution of higher learning. 

[Kobe University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KobeUniversity)
    
![Kobe University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/6005484934_23f8e708e6_b.jpg?h=6c3a7702&itok=0LaLZ3sU)
Kobe University, working in a spirit of integrity, freedom, and cooperation in keeping with its open and cosmopolitan culture and environs, aims to contribute to the global community through the creation of knowledge founded on universal values and the fostering of rich understanding and strong leadership skills. 

[Kyoto University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KyotoUniversity)
    
![Kyoto University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Kyoto_University_-_2009%27_faculty_members_strikes.jpg?h=f8018def&itok=EbibgWFb)
Kyoto University states its mission to sustain and develop its historical commitment to academic freedom and to pursue harmonious coexistence within the human and ecological community on this planet. 

[Kyushu University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KyushuUniversity)
    
![Kyushu University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Kyushu_University_Ito_Campus_Center_Zone_and_main_entrance_20180807.jpg?h=dd7be773&itok=ly4zmaX0)
Kyushu University, abbreviated to Kyudai, is a Japanese national university located in Fukuoka, in the island of Kyushu. It is the 4th oldest university in Japan and one of the former Imperial Universities. 

[Meiji University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#MeijiUniversity)
    
![Meiji University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Meiji_University_Nakano%2CCampus_%26_TeikyoHeiseiUniv-Nakano_2014.jpg?h=7cc22ff2&itok=Yj-v8YY-)
Meiji University was founded in January 1881 as the Meiji Law School by a group of young lawyers barely in their 30's: Tatsuo Kishimoto, Kozo Miyagi, and Misao Yashiro. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation. 

[Nagoya University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#NagoyaUniversity)
    
![Nagoya University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Nagoya_University_dk4586.jpg?h=44faebae&itok=TXJAowPB)
We aim to cultivate talented people who can exercise strong leadership in a rapidly changing world with their great wisdom and reliable knowledge and skills. 

[Okayama University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#OkayamaUniversity)
    
![Okayama University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Okayama_University_tsushima03.jpg?h=380cbecd&itok=SKutKFD3)
As one of the leading universities in Japan, we aim to create and establish a new paradigm for the sustainable development of the world. We are being confronted with problems of global proportions in terms of the environment, energy issues, food supplies, economics, health, security and education. 

[Otaru University of Commerce](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#OtaruUniversityofCommerce)
    
![Otaru canal](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Otaru_Hokkaido_Japan.jpg?h=47c8826e&itok=smmglzYs)
Otaru University of Commerce is and has been a center of social sciences and humanities in northern Japan. Reflecting its history of having been established as Otaru Higher Commercial School, the university has been emphasizing the link between theory and practice, in addition to its solid academic foundation. 

[Rikkyo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#RikkyoUniversity)
    
![Rikkyo University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/2018_Rikkyo_University_2_0.jpg?h=4ca3ccec&itok=OBxRXuEC)
Rikkyo University started in 1874 as Rikkyo School, a small private school teaching English and Bible studies in the foreign settlement in Tsukiji, Tokyo. The School was founded by Bishop Channing Moore Williams, a missionary dispatched from the American Episcopal Church. 

[Ritsumeikan University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#RitsumeikanUniversity)
    
![Ritsumeikan University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Zonshinkan_Hall_at_Ritsumeikan_Univ.jpg?h=f7b0690c&itok=F-udErAG)
Ritsumeikan University traces its origins back to 1869. It is now a university of around 35,000 students, situated in the city of Kyoto. 

[Seijo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#SeijoUniversity)
    
![Seijo University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Seijouniv2012055.jpg?h=83f468d0&itok=lPX2Pk8S)
Seijo University is well-known for its focus on the arts and social sciences, as well as its liberal atmosphere. Relatively small in size, our institution has adhered to its founding educational principles to foster broad-minded, well-rounded graduates, who are highly creative and are well prepared to do their part for society. 

[Sophia University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#SophiaUniversity)
    
![Sophia University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/12494889943_d0020a10a8_o.jpg?h=75e319e6&itok=0FqwfE0z)
The origin of Sophia University can be traced back to more than 450 years ago when the Jesuit missionary Francis Xavier came to Japan in 1549 to spread Christianity in Japan. Since then it has developed into one of Japan's leading research universities, and is based in the heart of Tokyo. 

[Tohoku University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#TohokuUniversity)
    
![Tohoku University buildings](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Tohoku_University_Hospital.jpg?h=93655462&itok=s_LcwWzh)
The university has around 20,000 students and is based in the city of Sendai in Miyagi. The ancient castle grounds of Sendai's famous feudal war lord Masamune Date, are home to the majority of Tohoku University's facilities. 

[Tsukuba University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#TsukubaUniversity)
    
![Tsukuba University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/University_of_Tsukuba_1.jpg?h=fae4e345&itok=I_pwPfrV)
The University of Tsukuba aims to be an open university in all aspects and we are a frontrunner in the university reform in Japan. Our fundamental principle is to create a flexible education and research structure as well as a university system to meet the needs of the next generation. 

[University of Osaka](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityofOsaka)
    
![Osaka University main entrance.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Osaka_university_toyonaka_main_entrance.jpg?h=7c9da7f9&itok=Gj8m0jpA)
The University of Osaka, or Handai, is a public research university located in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Osaka University is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is generally considered one of Japan's most prestigious institutions of higher learning. 

[University of the Ryukyus](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityoftheRyukyus)
    
![University of the Ryukyus hospital from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Ryukyu-univ_hospital.jpg?h=8d4f0e53&itok=yu95-mHi)
The University of the Ryukyus, abbreviated to Ryūdai, is a national university of Japan in Okinawa Prefecture. It is located in the Senbaru neighbourhood of the town of Nishihara, with its campus bordering both the village of Nakagusuku and the city of Ginowan. 

[University of Tokyo](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityofTokyo)
    
![University of Tokyo tower](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Yasuda_Auditorium%2C_Tokyo_University_-_Nov_2005.jpg?h=88c97200&itok=sL2Eobfz)
The University of Tokyo is comprised of 10 Faculties, 15 Graduate Schools, 11 affiliated research institutes (including the Research Center for Advanced Science and Technology), 13 University-wide centers, three affiliated libraries and two institutes for advanced study. 

[Waseda University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#WasedaUniversity)
    
![Aerial photo of Waseda University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Waseda_university_-_Waseda_campus.jpg?h=b5941091&itok=mab9adsJ)
Waseda’s culture and traditions have evolved over time since 1882, but its founding principles remain firm. The Waseda spirit lives in the hearts of over 600,000 alumni. Here we present the changing and unchanged about the university. 

[Yokohama National University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#YokohamaNationalUniversity)
    
![Yokohama National University library](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/YNU_library.jpg?h=16ef794e&itok=QwNEnqbz)
Ever since the port of Yokohama was opened in the 19th century, Yokohama has been a unique crossroad where West meets East. It is not too much to say that the modernization and internationalization of Japan started from Yokohama. Today, as Japan’s second largest city, Yokohama is recognized as one of the most exciting cities for its cultural, socio-economic, and infrastructural dynamism.
## A global reputation
Sheffield is a world top-100 research university with a global reputation for excellence. We're a member of the Russell Group: one of the 24 leading UK universities for research and teaching.
[About the University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/about/home)

# Japanese Studies
Our global partner universities for Japanese Studies.
Off 
## Undergraduate study abroad options
You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change.
### Japan 

[Akita International University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#AkitaInternationalUniversity)
    
![Akita International University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Exterior_of_Akita_International_University_Nakajima_Memorial_Library.jpg?h=9f320072&itok=K0eiBESr)
Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services. 

[Aoyama Gaukin University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#AoyamaGaukinUniversity)
    
![Aoyama Gakuin University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Aoyama_Gakuin_University_Sagamihara.jpg?h=1051cd3d&itok=7w5FKBZw)
Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity. 

[Chuo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#ChuoUniversity)
    
![Chuo University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/C-Square%2C_Tama_Campus%2C_Chuo_University.jpg?h=cd88aec0&itok=Ryq81dgE)
Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country. 

[Doshisha University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#DoshishaUniversity)
    
![Doshisha University from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/170128_Doshisha_University_Imadegawa_Campus_Kyoto_Japan08s3.jpg?h=666c4245&itok=MyXAzMIF)
Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story. 

[Hiroshima University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HiroshimaUniversity)
    
![Hiroshima University from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Hiroshima_University_Hospital_20140127.jpg?h=04850f14&itok=yGBsnmy1)
Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students. 

[Hokkaido University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HokkaidoUniversity)
    
![Hokkaido University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/The_Hokkaido_University_Museum.jpg?h=825ad812&itok=HaWSQ5xR)
Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan. 

[Hosei University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#HoseiUniversity)
    
![Hosei University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Ichigayatamachi_Building_-_Hosei_University_-_Shinjuku%2C_Tokyo%2C_Japan_-_DSC04580.jpg?h=ed5d71d4&itok=yfj1I8vM)
Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community. 

[International Christian University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#InternationalChristianUniversity)
    
![Fall foliage at Ghibli Museum in Mitaka, Japan.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/GettyImages-488332371.jpg?h=0296cbd6&itok=O4dUd6SB)
International Christian University holds as its mission the establishment of an academic tradition of freedom and reverence based on Christian ideals as well as the cultivation of internationally minded citizens who perform service to God and humankind and make contributions to lasting peace. 

[Kanazawa University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KanazawaUniversity)
    
![Administrative office for kanazawa university](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Administrative_Office_of_Kanazawa_University.jpg?h=b2ac61e6&itok=nNgYeFq0)
As the leading university on the Sea of Japan coast, Kanazawa University has contributed greatly to Japanese higher education and academic research since it was founded in 1949. 

[Keio University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KeioUniversity)
    
![Keio University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Old_Keio_University_Library_4.jpg?h=7bc0b7d3&itok=ehPHjKOe)
Established in 1858 by Yukichi Fukuzawa as a small school of Western learning, Keio has a history as Japan’s very first private institution of higher learning. 

[Kobe University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KobeUniversity)
    
![Kobe University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/6005484934_23f8e708e6_b.jpg?h=6c3a7702&itok=0LaLZ3sU)
Kobe University, working in a spirit of integrity, freedom, and cooperation in keeping with its open and cosmopolitan culture and environs, aims to contribute to the global community through the creation of knowledge founded on universal values and the fostering of rich understanding and strong leadership skills. 

[Kyoto University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KyotoUniversity)
    
![Kyoto University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Kyoto_University_-_2009%27_faculty_members_strikes.jpg?h=f8018def&itok=EbibgWFb)
Kyoto University states its mission to sustain and develop its historical commitment to academic freedom and to pursue harmonious coexistence within the human and ecological community on this planet. 

[Kyushu University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#KyushuUniversity)
    
![Kyushu University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Kyushu_University_Ito_Campus_Center_Zone_and_main_entrance_20180807.jpg?h=dd7be773&itok=ly4zmaX0)
Kyushu University, abbreviated to Kyudai, is a Japanese national university located in Fukuoka, in the island of Kyushu. It is the 4th oldest university in Japan and one of the former Imperial Universities. 

[Meiji University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#MeijiUniversity)
    
![Meiji University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Meiji_University_Nakano%2CCampus_%26_TeikyoHeiseiUniv-Nakano_2014.jpg?h=7cc22ff2&itok=Yj-v8YY-)
Meiji University was founded in January 1881 as the Meiji Law School by a group of young lawyers barely in their 30's: Tatsuo Kishimoto, Kozo Miyagi, and Misao Yashiro. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation. 

[Nagoya University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#NagoyaUniversity)
    
![Nagoya University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Nagoya_University_dk4586.jpg?h=44faebae&itok=TXJAowPB)
We aim to cultivate talented people who can exercise strong leadership in a rapidly changing world with their great wisdom and reliable knowledge and skills. 

[Okayama University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#OkayamaUniversity)
    
![Okayama University from the outside](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Okayama_University_tsushima03.jpg?h=380cbecd&itok=SKutKFD3)
As one of the leading universities in Japan, we aim to create and establish a new paradigm for the sustainable development of the world. We are being confronted with problems of global proportions in terms of the environment, energy issues, food supplies, economics, health, security and education. 

[Otaru University of Commerce](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#OtaruUniversityofCommerce)
    
![Otaru canal](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Otaru_Hokkaido_Japan.jpg?h=47c8826e&itok=smmglzYs)
Otaru University of Commerce is and has been a center of social sciences and humanities in northern Japan. Reflecting its history of having been established as Otaru Higher Commercial School, the university has been emphasizing the link between theory and practice, in addition to its solid academic foundation. 

[Rikkyo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#RikkyoUniversity)
    
![Rikkyo University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/2018_Rikkyo_University_2_0.jpg?h=4ca3ccec&itok=OBxRXuEC)
Rikkyo University started in 1874 as Rikkyo School, a small private school teaching English and Bible studies in the foreign settlement in Tsukiji, Tokyo. The School was founded by Bishop Channing Moore Williams, a missionary dispatched from the American Episcopal Church. 

[Ritsumeikan University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#RitsumeikanUniversity)
    
![Ritsumeikan University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Zonshinkan_Hall_at_Ritsumeikan_Univ.jpg?h=f7b0690c&itok=F-udErAG)
Ritsumeikan University traces its origins back to 1869. It is now a university of around 35,000 students, situated in the city of Kyoto. 

[Seijo University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#SeijoUniversity)
    
![Seijo University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Seijouniv2012055.jpg?h=83f468d0&itok=lPX2Pk8S)
Seijo University is well-known for its focus on the arts and social sciences, as well as its liberal atmosphere. Relatively small in size, our institution has adhered to its founding educational principles to foster broad-minded, well-rounded graduates, who are highly creative and are well prepared to do their part for society. 

[Sophia University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#SophiaUniversity)
    
![Sophia University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/12494889943_d0020a10a8_o.jpg?h=75e319e6&itok=0FqwfE0z)
The origin of Sophia University can be traced back to more than 450 years ago when the Jesuit missionary Francis Xavier came to Japan in 1549 to spread Christianity in Japan. Since then it has developed into one of Japan's leading research universities, and is based in the heart of Tokyo. 

[Tohoku University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#TohokuUniversity)
    
![Tohoku University buildings](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Tohoku_University_Hospital.jpg?h=93655462&itok=s_LcwWzh)
The university has around 20,000 students and is based in the city of Sendai in Miyagi. The ancient castle grounds of Sendai's famous feudal war lord Masamune Date, are home to the majority of Tohoku University's facilities. 

[Tsukuba University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#TsukubaUniversity)
    
![Tsukuba University campus](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/University_of_Tsukuba_1.jpg?h=fae4e345&itok=I_pwPfrV)
The University of Tsukuba aims to be an open university in all aspects and we are a frontrunner in the university reform in Japan. Our fundamental principle is to create a flexible education and research structure as well as a university system to meet the needs of the next generation. 

[University of Osaka](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityofOsaka)
    
![Osaka University main entrance.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Osaka_university_toyonaka_main_entrance.jpg?h=7c9da7f9&itok=Gj8m0jpA)
The University of Osaka, or Handai, is a public research university located in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. Osaka University is one of Japan's National Seven Universities and is generally considered one of Japan's most prestigious institutions of higher learning. 

[University of the Ryukyus](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityoftheRyukyus)
    
![University of the Ryukyus hospital from the outside.](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Ryukyu-univ_hospital.jpg?h=8d4f0e53&itok=yu95-mHi)
The University of the Ryukyus, abbreviated to Ryūdai, is a national university of Japan in Okinawa Prefecture. It is located in the Senbaru neighbourhood of the town of Nishihara, with its campus bordering both the village of Nakagusuku and the city of Ginowan. 

[University of Tokyo](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#UniversityofTokyo)
    
![University of Tokyo tower](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Yasuda_Auditorium%2C_Tokyo_University_-_Nov_2005.jpg?h=88c97200&itok=sL2Eobfz)
The University of Tokyo is comprised of 10 Faculties, 15 Graduate Schools, 11 affiliated research institutes (including the Research Center for Advanced Science and Technology), 13 University-wide centers, three affiliated libraries and two institutes for advanced study. 

[Waseda University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#WasedaUniversity)
    
![Aerial photo of Waseda University](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/Waseda_university_-_Waseda_campus.jpg?h=b5941091&itok=mab9adsJ)
Waseda’s culture and traditions have evolved over time since 1882, but its founding principles remain firm. The Waseda spirit lives in the hearts of over 600,000 alumni. Here we present the changing and unchanged about the university. 

[Yokohama National University](https://www.sheffield.ac.uk/globalopps/outbound/study-abroad/where/japanese#YokohamaNationalUniversity)
    
![Yokohama National University library](https://cdn.sheffield.ac.uk/sites/default/files/styles/mobile_single_column_1x/public/2020-01/YNU_library.jpg?h=16ef794e&itok=QwNEnqbz)
Ever since the port of Yokohama was opened in the 19th century, Yokohama has been a unique crossroad where West meets East. It is not too much to say that the modernization and internationalization of Japan started from Yokohama. Today, as Japan’s second largest city, Yokohama is recognized as one of the most exciting cities for its cultural, socio-economic, and infrastructural dynamism.
## A global reputation
Sheffield is a world top-100 research university with a global reputation for excellence. We're a member of the Russell Group: one of the 24 leading UK universities for research and teaching.

Off Undergraduate study abroad options You’ll spend a year studying at a Japanese university as part of your degree, putting what you've learned into practice and gaining life-changing experience. Please note that destinations are subject to change. Japan Akita International University Akita International University, AIU, is a four-year liberal arts university located in Akita prefecture in the Tohoku region of northern Japan. AIU is located in Akita city, the capital of Akita prefecture (population about 960,000), an ideally-sized city to provide the opportunity to get immersed in the friendly, local culture while also offering convenient access to international goods and services. Aoyama Gaukin University Our institution nurtures people who, with a sound understanding based on global perspectives, possess the wisdom and strength with which to discover and solve issues personally. This is achieved through a wide range of barrier free academic research that pursues service and commitment to humanity. Chuo University Chuo University is a private flagship research university in Tokyo, Japan. Founded in 1885 as Igirisu Hōritsu Gakkō (the English Law School), Chuo is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions in the country. Doshisha University Doshisha University has two main campuses. One is the Imadegawa Campus located in the heart of Kyoto City, north of Kyoto Imperial Palace and adjacent to a noted Buddhist temple, Shokokuji. As the birthplace of Doshisha University, the history of the Imadegawa Campus is an integral part of Doshisha 144-year-old story. Hiroshima University Hiroshima University, in the Japanese cities of Higashihiroshima and Hiroshima, was established 1929 by the merger of a number of national educational institutions. It has over 3,000 academic staff and over 16,000 students. Hokkaido University Hokkaido University is a leading comprehensive university that places importance on its graduate schools. The university started out in 1876 as the Sapporo Agricultural College, the first modern academic institute in Japan. Hosei University Hosei University’s mission is to tackle the many and varied problems facing humanity in this turbulent twenty-first century and help to build a sustainable global community. International Christian University International Christian University holds as its mission the establishment of an academic tradition of freedom and reverence based on Christian ideals as well as the cultivation of internationally minded citizens who perform service to God and humankind and make contributions to lasting peace. Kanazawa University As the leading university on the Sea of Japan coast, Kanazawa University has contributed greatly to Japanese higher education and academic research since it was founded in 1949. Keio University Established in 1858 by Yukichi Fukuzawa as a small school of Western learning, Keio has a history as Japan’s very first private institution of higher learning. Kobe University Kobe University, working in a spirit of integrity, freedom, and cooperation in keeping with its open and cosmopolitan culture and environs, aims to contribute to the global community through the creation of knowledge founded on universal values and the fostering of rich understanding and strong leadership skills. Kyoto University Kyoto University states its mission to sustain and develop its historical commitment to academic freedom and to pursue harmonious coexistence within the human and ecological community on this planet. It is the 4th oldest university in Japan and one of the former Imperial Universities. It was an era characterized by Japan's urgent need to develop as a modern independent nation. Okayama University As one of the leading universities in Japan, we aim to create and establish a new paradigm for the sustainable development of the world. We are being confronted with problems of global proportions in terms of the environment, energy issues, food supplies, economics, health, security and education. Reflecting its history of having been established as Otaru Higher Commercial School, the university has been emphasizing the link between theory and practice, in addition to its solid academic foundation. images.desc: The University of the Ryukyus, abbreviated to Ryūdai, is a national university of Japan in Okinawa Prefecture. It is located in the Senbaru neighbourhood of the town of Nishihara, with its campus bordering both the village of Nakagusuku and the city of Ginowan.

The University of Tokyo is comprised of 10 Faculties, 15 Graduate Schools, 11 affiliated research institutes (including the Research Center for Advanced Science and Technology), 13 University-wide centers, three affiliated libraries and two institutes for advanced study.

Waseda’s culture and traditions have evolved over time since 1882, but its founding principles remain firm. The Waseda spirit lives in the hearts of over 600,000 alumni. Here we present the changing and unchanged about the university.

Ever since the port of Yokohama was opened in the 19th century, Yokohama has been a unique crossroad where West meets East. It is not too much to say that the modernization and internationalization of Japan started from Yokohama. Today, as Japan’s second largest city, Yokohama is recognized as one of the most exciting cities for its cultural, socio-economic, and infrastructural dynamism.
